fields.summary: "E" keyboard shortcut to go back to edit from preview
Support displaying other JIRA issue link types in a column for the JIRA issues macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31345].
  {panel}

There are a few features that would make the user macro editor much better.

* Better code editor
** Something like ACE with syntax highlighting for HTML and Velocity, line numbers, ability to tab in the editor for indentation, etc. would be awesome.
* Ability to save asynchronously
** Currently if you want to save you have to hit the save button, then go to a page to see if the code is correct and then if it isn't right to have to open up the macro again for editing. Asynchronous save would save quite a few clicks and page refreshes and make the editing experience much faster.
* Macro History
** It would be great to have a history similar to page history to see the changes to a user macro over time.
fields.summary: Enhanced User Macro Editor

fields.description: In Confluence 5.1 and 5.3 I can reproduce this doing the following: Adding recently-updated-dashboard within a space (for example space homepage) then loading the page. It first displays only the results from the current space. when you switch tabs, it finally reloads and displays all recent updates.
fields.summary: recently-updated-dashboard does not work properly within a space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31339].
  {panel}

The data from Epic Link is not consistent with results retrieved from JIRA's Issue Navigator. 

_In JIRA_
The Epic Link column in Issue Navigator will show the Epic Name
!jira.png|thumbnail!

_In Confluence_
The Epic Name is not shown (as in JIRA) although we have set the same column Epic Link. Instead it shows the Epic ID. 
!conf_1.png|thumbnail!

!conf_2.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
Add another JIRA Issue Macro to retrieve all epics, and include Epic Name column for reference in Confluence.
!epic.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Should show epic link in JIM (not epic id)

fields.description:
We have the following setup:
* User Directories
*# Sun Directory Server (Read Only, with Local Groups)
*# internal 
* all users are manged in LDAP
* user is member of static and dynamic groups in LDAP
* LDAP synchronization works correctly

When a user logs in, it is removed from all dynamic LDAP groups (see screenshots). After synchronizing all group memberships are restored.

Confluence is not usable anymore as permissions to access a space are given to dynamic LDAP groups.

This bug prevents us from updating to Confluence 5.3.
fields.summary: Login removes user from all dynamic LDAP groups

fields.description:
The loadattachmentsversions action is accessible to any user of Confluence and returns version history information for an attachment. No access controls appear to be implemented for this action and any user of Confluence can obtain version history for any attachment, including those on pages in inaccessible spaces, simply by specifying the appropriate resource identifier. Whilst this is a relatively minor information leak, it should be noted that the HTML returned by this action discloses the attachment file name, the users who made modifications to the attachment and any comments associated to each version. It is not inconceivable that this information may be of use to an attacker, although the risk is likely to be low. On a test instance of Confluence, A GET request to the following URL as user “phill” returns version data for the attachment with resource id 884781: http://confluenceserver:8090//pages/plugins/attachments/loadattachmentversions.action?attachmentId=884781 This attachment resides on a page in a space that the user “phill” has no access to. The following HTML is returned:
Version history
Version 1 (current version) Created by admin   Oct 02, 2013
In this case, a single version of the attachment exists and the file name, creator user name and comments (blank in this case) are clearly visible. Note that appropriate access controls are applied if the link is accessed and the attachment itself is not accessible.
fields.summary: Missing access controls in loadattachmentversions action
Seperate View and Admin Permissions

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When upgrading, the task fails with a message like:

{code:none}
2013-10-15 08:05:27,164 ERROR [main] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener] contextInitialized Upgrade failed, application will not start: Upgrade task com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.LowerCaseUsernameReferencesUpgradeTask@90580fa failed during the SCHEMA_UPGRADE phase due to: Table 'NOTIFICATIONS' has more than one primary key
com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeException: Upgrade task com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.LowerCaseUsernameReferencesUpgradeTask@90580fa failed during the SCHEMA_UPGRADE phase due to: Table 'NOTIFICATIONS' has more than one primary key
{code}

This is due to the Hibernate bug [https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HHH-2208], which is fixed, but Confluence still uses an old version including this bug. Ordinarily, the workaround of creating a schema-local "all_objects" view has prevented issues which have come up, however in this case, that workaround does not work.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Install Confluence into multiple schemas in the same Oracle database at a version below 5.2
# Attempt to upgrade one of them to 5.2

h4. Workaround

Follow the steps in the KB article [Upgrade Failed with "Table '<Table Name>' has more than one primary key" Error Message|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=419004803]
fields.summary: Upgrade to 5.2 or above on Oracle fails with "Table 'X' has more than one primary key" if another schema exists containing a shared table name

fields.description:
I was in a list and wanted to add a quote under the current li.

I pressed shift+enter, then bq.

That resulted in the whole list being wrapped in a quote block, instead of the quote block being inserted within the list.

I undid that and tried using {quote

That resulted in a block quote where I expected, although the cursor moved down to the next line which was unexpected. After moving it back up I was able to type as expected.
fields.summary: bq. wraps the list it was typed in
Warning messages in logs caused by sub-optimal use of commons httpclient

fields.description:
This happens (but might not be limited to) when there are two users who both have the 'Confluence Administrator and 'System Administrator' global permissions. These two global permissions are given by default to all users in the confluence-administrators group.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
1. As a user in confluence-administrators (say userOne), create a new page
2. Set the page restrictions so viewing is restricted to userOne only
3. Log in as another use in confluence-administrators (say userTwo) and view the page you just created (you should have permissions to do this since you're sys admin)
4. Click the 'Edit' button
5. Edit and save the page - you will be taken to the 'Not Permitted' page
6. Go back to the page and remove the page permissions
7. Edit and save the page - your changes will be saved successfully

This behaviour is strange. Either, as a System administrator, you are allowed full permission to edit any pages OR if you can't edit a page, the 'Edit' button should not be displayed and you shouldn't be allowed to load the editor.

The behaviour remains the same for child pages as well.
fields.summary: confluence-administrators permission shows page edit button but does not allow page edit

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When saving a page containing a table, where a cell has had some formatting whitespace inserted, the extra whitespace will be lost on save. This happens for all browsers other than IE8. Any other location on the page not in a table cell will preserve extra whitespace.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page
# Insert a table
# Insert some text with whitespace indenting some or all lines
fields.summary: Saving a page loses whitespace inside table cells when using any browser other than IE8

fields.description: Centering a table of any size in any section of the page does not render as centered.  The WYSIWYG editor shows the table as centered, but after previewing or saving the page, the table will still show up as left justified.
fields.summary: Tables Not Staying Centered
need support for XLSM files in addition to xlsx.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31324].
  {panel}

The [Universal Wiki Converter|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.uwc] (UWC) does not support Confluence 5+ but it is still mentioned in documentation. We should remove any mention in the documentation for those version.

Examples pages in the current documentation:
* [Importing Content from Another Wiki|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Importing+Content+from+Another+Wiki].
* [Importing Content Into Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Importing+Content+Into+Confluence#ImportingContentIntoConfluence-Importingcontentfromotherwikis].
fields.summary: UWC does not support Confluence 5+ but it is still mentioned in documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you add a link to the image and then try to move to a different place of the page the link in the image is gone, hence you need to add it again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an image to the page
 # Attach a link to the image (space / web)
 # Save the changes
 # Edit the page
 # Move the image to the different place of the page

h3. Expected Results

The image is moved together with attached link

h3. Actual Results

The page is moved without the link. See [^Moving Linked Images Loses Links.mp4] for reference.

h3. Workaround

Use Cut (Ctrl+X or CMD+X) and Paste (Ctrl+V or CMD+V) to move the image instead drug&drop.
fields.summary: Moving Linked Images result in the loss of the link.

fields.description:

Affected Version: confluence 5.2.3 standalone
fields.summary: TOC links broken if special chars used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31320].
  {panel}

The code macro's 'Collapsible' parameter in the macro browser should be labelled 'Collapsed'.

Why?
* Currently, you can only expand collapsed code, which means it is not 'collapsible'.
* Even if (later down the track), you intend to make expanded code collapsible again _AND_ if the intention is to render code as collapsed upon first visiting a page or refreshing it, then 'Collapsed' is still correct in this context.
* It'll match the wiki markup notation.
fields.summary: The code macro's 'Collapsible' parameter in the macro browser should be labelled 'Collapsed' to better represent its true functionality.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31319].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Keyboard+Shortcuts

The shortcut "w" does not add or edit watchers any more since 5.x
Instead, it adds or removes the current user from the page.
In order to add or edit other watchers to the space, the user needs to click the "Watch" button, after which a small menu opens up
fields.summary: Adjust Keyboard Shortcuts in most recent documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31318].
  {panel}

When trying to save a Confluence Page with an iframe that has an invalid 'Long Description' or 'URL', the following message is displayed:

{panel:bgColor=#d04437}{color:white}(!)The following error(s) occurred:
* Failure when converting editor format to storage format.{color}{panel}

Also, when previewing changes:
{panel:bgColor=#d04437}{color:white}(!)The following error(s) occurred:
* There was an error loading preview. Please try again later.{color}{panel}

*Cause:*
* The 'URL' and 'Long Description' parameters don't allow spaces. They are URLs like indicated by their descriptions: 
*- URL: _"The URL of the document to show in the iframe"_
*- Long Description: _"A URL to a long description of the frame contents"_

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a new page with an iframe
# set either URL or Long Description with a text with spaces
# Try saving page: *Results in error*
# Set URL to a text without spaces or a URL
# Try saving page: *Page Saved*

*Solution:*
* Use a URL

*Bug:*
* The error message is unclear
* No verification is done on the iframe macro before saving.
* URL parameter is clearly a URL but 'Long Description' is unclear. Changing it to 'Long Description URL' might help.
fields.summary: iframe macro displays "Failure when converting editor format to storage format" when saving

fields.description:
It seems changes related to dev changes, changed expected type of the Princiapl set during authentication from java.security.Principal to com.atlassian.confluence.security.seraph.ConfluenceUserPrincipal

The authentication process for Trusted Apps links was updated for this by adding a com.atlassian.confluence.security.trust.seraph.ConfluenceSeraphAuthenticationListener which converts the Principal into ConfluenceUserPrincipal.

OAuth was not updated and calls would appear to fail despite the OAuth processing working correctly, see https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1092
fields.summary: Confluence is not supporting 2LOi OAuth calls.
Log debug information to help resolve com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31313].
  {panel}

Just as the summary suggests. It would be great if we could merge accounts and change usernames.

Here is why we need this:
Accounts are added and removed all the time. It would be great to merge accounts so that the data ownership belongs to person that is active.

Username changes happen all the time, especially when people get married.

We are currently migrating several users from ldap to active directory. Unfortunately we have to de-activate there ldap account and create a brand new account for active directory. This becomes really messy, since we have several deactivated accounts where the user is active in another account. It would be nice if we can merge accounts.
fields.summary: Merge accounts and change usernames.

fields.summary: No recent activities from network shown

fields.description:
If you change the title of a page, the change comment is not saved. The result is the same even if you change the page content.

To reproduce:
# Create a new page, give it a title of "Title test", save it
# Edit the page again, change the title, add a change comment of "title changed", save it
# Edit the page again, change the title and the content, add a change comment of "title and content changed", save it
# Edit the page again, change the content only, add a change comment of "content only changed"

*Expected result:* 4 versions of the page, 3 of which have change comments

*Result:* 4 versions of the page, 1 of which has a change comment

So changing the page title loses the change comment regardless of whether the content is changed or not.
fields.summary: Change comment is lost when page title is changed

Radim

fields.description:
I have selected "subscribe to daily digest" and "show changed content" in Settings -> Email.
!email.jpg|thumbnail!

According to the confluence manual, this should result in a single (not more) email every day (daily digest) that lists 
* which pages have been edited by whom
* and what the changes are

The bug is that the digest email *does not show the changed content of the pages* but only lists which pages have been edited by whom. 
!email1.jpg|thumbnail!

That means the "show changed content" option is broken. I had the same issue with confluence 5.1.4 as well.
fields.summary: Daily email digest does not "show changed content"

Support for SQL Azure

fields.description:
h4.Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a page
# Insert Panel Macro
# Use Heading1 or heading2 in the panel
# Save the page
  
h4.Expected Results:
 The expected result should be like the screen shot below:
!panel 51.png!
(!) The screen shot is taken from Confluence 5.1.

 h4.Actual Results:
There will be a space of line when heading1 and heading2 is used, and you may refer to the screen shot below.
!panel 53.png!

h4.Findings:

- This behavior does not occur in Confluence 5.1
- It does happen in Confluence 5.3

h4. Workaround:

(i) This workaround does not work in documentation theme, and works in default theme only. 

- Go to *Confluence admin > Stylesheet > Edit* and add the following line:
{code}
.panel h1 {
margin-top:0px !important;
}
{code}
- Then press *Save*
fields.summary: Heading1 and Heading2 leaves a space at the beginning of Panel macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31282].
  {panel}

In the Excel embed macro, there are four options:

1) Attachment.
2) Sheet name.
3) Maximum column.
4) Maximum row.

The macro then embeds a subset of the sheet, from (0,0) to (maxCol,maxRow).

Unfortunately, this makes it rather difficult to deal with content from complex spreadsheet.

It seems to me that it would not be terribly complicated to add a minimum value for column and row, and that this would substantially increase the value of this macro.
fields.summary: Add customisable start point when embedding portion of Excel spreadsheet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31280].
  {panel}

When you go to create page in Chrome 30 the editor does not focus the body of the page by default.

Reproduce:
1. Open latest Chrome
2. Go to https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=JIRADEV

Notice how the editor did not receive focus.

Probably related to CONFDEV-20335.
fields.summary: Editor doesn't auto focus in latest Chrome

fields.description:
Discussed with [~pkuo] this morning, I don't think this has been resolved properly since the 5.0 work.

When you zoom in you can see that the emoticon doesn't sit vertically centred in relation to the text, it sits a pixel or two too low (see attached).

As mentioned on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-15193, setting vertical-align to text-bottom seems to set the alignment correctly, at least in my browser (Chrome).

I've been using this page as a test: https://pug.jira.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=492535859

I'm on Chrome, we're seeing it in Safari and Firefox also.

Set priority as major as this has been lingering for a while.
fields.summary: Emoticons not correctly vertically aligned in wiki content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31274].
  {panel}

As we have a lot of projects that are constantly created, I want to improve our home template.

My goal was to have links to create templates of the different documents that are required for each project, and then include that excerpt or page into the space home page template.

For example:
You create a project in JIRA. That JIRA project creates a space in Confluence titled the same as the project. Lets call it Project Cheese.

That confluence project uses the global template, and creates a page.

On that page, it would include a link to create a template for the other pages needed (scope, content needs, etc...). 

Clicking that button would create a page for that template in the space that page is currently in, i.e. space: Cheese. 

With that document created, an on the Cheese homepage would insert the page into that page based on the name of the newly created page (i.e. Scope) that is in that space (Cheese). 

Right now, I almost have this with Confluence, but then it goes worthless.

You can have a link to create a template, but it always goes to the same location (Space: TrashHeap), and NOT the location of the space the link is coming from (Cheese).

Similar, the insert page contents can only exist from an existing page, and not a page that is to be created.

I want to be able to have a button to create a doc based on a template, in the same space I am in right now, and to have that page, or an excerpt of that page that will be created, automatically added to the space page I am in right now.
fields.summary: Template and Insert Page functionality with variable pages and spaces
Confluence should detect modifications to server.xml

fields.description:
Ever since I upgraded to Windows 8.1 (and thus IE11), I can't type a period in edit mode for a page at the end of a sentence. I can type a space, go back to the left one character, and then type the period.

Strangest thing, and can reproduce. Did not happen in in IE10.
fields.summary: Cannot type a period at the end of a sentence in ie11
Font sizes in the Popular Labels Macro Heatmap are being overridden when placed in the footer section of a page layout in 5.1.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31265].
  {panel}

Some of our Confluence wiki pages have fairly long tables on them.

When the system generates a "change" email to notify watchers of changes to those pages, it always includes the whole table in the email, instead of picking out just the changed section. This can make the change very hard to find if the table has more than a handful of rows (some of our tables have 100+ rows).

I would expect the system to pick out just the changed areas of table-heavy pages, as it does for text-only pages.

h2. Repro steps

Create a Confluence page with a table which has 100 rows.
As user A, subscribe to updates to this page.
As user B, edit row #75 in the table.
As user A, check for a page changed email

h2. Expected outcome

User A should receive an email clearly showing that user B has edited row #75. Some nearby context may be included in the email to aid comprehension, but no more than a handful of nearby rows should be included.

h2. Observed outcome

User A receives an email with all 100 rows of the table. Row #75 is highlighted in pale green to show the edit, but this is very hard to find in such a long email.

h2. Affected versions

Atlassian Confluence 5.2
fields.summary: Change emails include whole table, rather than extracting local context
'Edit in Office' does not work with Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31263].
  {panel}

1. Insert a non-breaking space by using one of the following methods:
* "Insert Symbol" tool 
* Insert   manually into the code. 
2. After saving, line breaking is inhibited as expected.
3. Reopen the editor: You can't distinguish non-breaking spaces from regular spaces.
4. Check in XHTML code: You can't distinguish non-breaking spaces from regular spaces.

Expectation:
Distinguish regular spaces from non-breaking spaces is possible for controlling line-breaking in particular editing cases.

Problem:
No monitoring checking possible for editors and reviewers.
fields.summary: Distinguish non-breaking spaces from regular spaces in editor and code

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31255].
  {panel}

h5. Symptoms

When using the Page Tree Macro, with "Include Excerpts in Page Tree" option, and an excerpt macro on one of the pages includes some text formatting, then the Page Tree Macro shows the raw HTML codes, rather than formatted or stripped text.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page with an except macro, containing formatted text
# Create a page with a page tree macro, including the page with the excerpt
# Observe the excerpt with raw HTML codes in it

h5. Workaround

Don't use formatting in the excerpt macro.
fields.summary: Page Tree Macro with "Include Excerpts" option shows raw HTML for formatted text

Error formatting macro after Brazilian time change.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

1-) Crowd 2.6 with Delegated Authentication Directory, with the following options activated:
a.) Delegated directory type: Microsoft Active Directory.
b.) Use Node referrals.
c.) Use Nested Groups.
d.) Sync users details.
2-) Confluence 3.4.6
3-) Then upgrade to Confluence 5.1.4
4-) The Confluence upgrade process finishes correctly, but no one who belong to the Confluences-administrator group through a nested group is able to see all the Spaces, and when you check the new DB table [cwd_directory_attribute] the "usedNestedGroups" attribute is missing.

h3. Workaround:

So in order to fix it you either insert manually this attribute in that table and set its value to true, or proceed creating a new Crowd Directory through the Users Directories menu in Confluence.
fields.summary: usedNestedGroups attribute is missed during the upgrade from 3.4.6 to 5.1.4

Very Respectfully,
Barbara

Thank you in advance for your help and your time.

Tiziana

fields.description:

h4.Steps to Reproduce:

# Set the browser first language to the same language that you set for your Confluence.

h4.Actual Results:

fields.summary: Problem with links in Confluence

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a page that starts with '0000/00/xx', where 0 is a number, and 'xx' is a string that contains at least one letter. Other examples include:
## 1991/07/0a
## 2013/10/03 - test
## 1892/01/broken
## 2015/08/02 Case 02 with problem 
# Create a second page, and add a link to your first page.
# Attempt to view the Page Information of your second page. (*Tools > Page Information*).

*Results:*
The following stack trace is produced:

{code}org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getOutgoingLinks' in  class com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.PageInfoAction threw exception java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "apples" at /pages/viewinfo.vm[line 359, column 39]
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.evaluate(ASTReference.java:470)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTAndNode.evaluate(ASTAndNode.java:104)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.evaluate(ASTExpression.java:62)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTOrNode.evaluate(ASTOrNode.java:98)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.evaluate(ASTExpression.java:62)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:85)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:159)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336)
	at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:328){code}

h5.Known Good Formats
The following examples of title do *not* cause the problem mentioned, and could be used as an alternative:

# 02/08/2015 Title
# 08/02/2015 Title
# 2015-08-02 Title
# Any text before a problematic date, eg "-2015/08/02 Case 02 with problem"
fields.summary: Linking to a page with a title of the format 0000/00/xx will cause the 'Page Information' page to break

fields.description:
Confluence sometimes sends E-mails to users, e.g. when watching pages.
If the profile picture of a user contains only ascii characters and no spaces, the email contains the user profile picture.
When the profile picture contains a space or e.g. german umlauts, the profile picture is NOT part of the emails sent from Confluence.

Attached you find an example for a user which has a profile picture with a german umlaut
fields.summary: Profile Pictures in E-Mails do not contain picture if profile picture name contains spaces or umlauts
